headline.main: Health of Nation Lags Behind Scientific Gains; Health of the Nation Lagging Behind the Great Advances of Medical Science

docs.abstract: NY Times survey of US health care cites current epidemic of venereal diseases while noting that med science has made advances in curing many infectious diseases with antibiotics

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr.Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 15 -- American medical science has made spectacular advances in the last quarter-century, but improvements in the over-all American death rate and the infant and maternal mortality rates have leveled off and the United States still lags behind many other nations.
